data: ORTHO Hip and Knee Arthroplasty - Post Operative (Multiphase)
Nurse to initiate the Surgeon Immediate Post Operative phase.  These orders continue on the inpatient unit
Discontinue ORTHO Elective -  Pre Operative (Day of Surgery) PowerPlan
Ortho Elective - Total Knee Arthroplasty Clinical Pathway - Adult
Ortho Elective - Total Hip Arthroplasty Clinical Pathway - Adult
Of affected limb(s): once baseline on admission, then q4h for 24 hours, then q12h and PRN
Once baseline on admission, then q4h for 24 hours, then q12h and PRN
For compartment syndrome with pain q1h for 12 hours, then q2h for 12 hours
For compartment syndrome with pain q2h for 12 hours, then q4h for 36 hours, then PRN only
For compartment syndrome with pain q2h for 12 hours, then q4h for 36 hours, then q12h for 48 hours, then PRN only
for 24 hour, Strict in and out x 24 hours and then PRN
Notify MD/NP if temperature is 39 DegC or greater
SBP goal: < 180 mmHg, Temp goal: < 39 degC, SpO2 goal: 94% or greater
BID, Patient to brush teeth and tongue. If dependent for personal care, clean teeth and tongue BID
Deep breathing and coughing exercises 5 to 10 times per hour and PRN
Start post-op day 0: Cryotherapy continuously. Refill ice as needed
PRN, Apply on no longer than 20 minutes (unless using a cryotherapy cuff which can be used continuously with a barrier between the skin and the sleeve)
Site: Hip and/or knee dressing(s), Dressing type: Other (please specify), Dressing assessment q8h, Reinforce PRN
Site: Hip and/or knee dressing(s), Dressing type: Other (please specify), use: Dressing type: Silicone foam and mepilex or honey comb dressing (per site), Reinforce PRN, Assess dressing q8h
Site: Surgical incision(s), Dressing type: Silicone foam | Mepilex | Other (please specify), use: and honeycomb dressing (per site), Change dressing as directed, Change dressing PRN, Reinforce PRN
Site: Surgical incision(s), Reinforce PRN, No dressing change

Avoid catheter unless one or more indicators met:    - Retention not relieved by 2 in and out catheters   - Critically ill-accurate output required   - Advanced pressure ulcer & incontinent   - End of life comfort   - Severe pain unrelieved with analgesics
q6h, use bladder scanner if not voiding
If no catheter in situ or post catheter removal, assess patient for ability to void q6h using bladder scanner, if urine output less than 180 mL in 6 hours, notify MD/NP in AM
If unable to void, bladder discomfort or voiding small amounts, bladder scan
If PVR greater than 400 mL, Or if unable to void, perform straight intermittent catheterization x 2 PRN. If third catheterization is required, leave catheter in place and inform MD / NP
If urine output less than 180 mL in 6 hours (30 mL/h)
T+1;0600, Post-op day 1 at 0600 or when epidural infusion discontinued
Prior to leaving PACU or when epidural infusion discontinued
T+2;0600, Post-op day 2 at 0600 or when epidural infusion discontinued
Mobilize post-op day 0 with supervision by RN/PT
Left lower extremity, Weight bearing as tolerated
Left lower extremity, partial weight-bearing, 75 kg
Left lower extremity, partial weight-bearing, 50 kg
Left lower extremity, partial weight-bearing, 20 kg
Left upper extremity, Weight bearing as tolerated
Right lower extremity, Weight bearing as tolerated
Right lower extremity, partial weight-bearing, 75 kg
Right lower extremity, partial weight-bearing, 50 kg
Right lower extremity, partial weight-bearing, 20 kg
Right upper extremity, Weight bearing as tolerated

No internal hip rotation in flexion | No external hip rotation in extension | No hip adduction beyond midline | Other (please specify), Do NOT place a pillow under the knee for knee replacement (may elevate entire limb)
Other (please specify), Allow hip flexion past 90 degrees if legs abducted
Pillow under the knee post operatively for 4 hours (may elevate entire limb)

Patients receiving post operative prophylactic dalteparin and continuous epidural analgesia should NOT receive concomitant antiplatelet agents (ASA, NSAIDS, clopidogrel, ticlopidine) or other anticoagulant (warfarin, dextran or treatment doses of unfractionated heparin)

Medication(s) to be held: ACEI and ARB, Instructions: HOLD ACEI (e.g. ramipril, trandolapril, caPTOPRil, enalapril, perindopril, quinAPRIL) and ARB (e.g. losartan, candesartan, irbesartan, olmesartan, valsartan) x 72 hours post operative
20 mg, PO, q6h, PRN hypertension, drug form: tab
No post operative antibiotics (as per Regional Surgical Antibiotic Prophylaxis Guidelines)

ceFAZolin can be safely administered to patients with penicillin allergy, including anaphylaxis. Do NOT administer if severe delayed skin reaction to any beta-lactam (e.g. drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis)
1,000 mg, IV, q8h, order duration: 2 doses or times, drug form: bag
2,000 mg, IV, q8h, order duration: 2 doses or times, drug form: bag
3,000 mg, IV, q8h, order duration: 2 doses or times, drug form: bag
If ceFAZolin allergic or severe delayed skin reactions to penicillins (e.g. SJS, TEN, DRESS) or contraindicated
1,000 mg, IV, once, administer over: 60 minute
1,500 mg, IV, once, administer over: 90 minute
No meperidine, no benzodiazepines unless used by patient prior to admission
1 tab, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab, start: T+2;0800
500 mg, (elem calcium 500 mg = calcium carbonate 1250 mg), PO, qdaily, drug form: tab, start: T+2;0800
1,000 unit, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab, start: T+2;0800
100 mg, (elem iron 100 mg = ferrous fumarate 300 mg), PO, q2day, drug form: tab, start: T+2;2000
100 mg, (elem iron 100 mg = ferrous fumarate 300 mg), PO, qdaily, drug form: tab, start: T+2;2000
100 mg, (elem iron 100 mg = ferrous fumarate 300 mg), PO, BID, drug form: tab, start: T+2;1400
CBC is recommended if patient has significant cardiac disease history
Blood, STAT, Collection: T;N, once for 1 doses or times
Hgb < 95, For patients with significant cardiac and/or coronary artery disease
Notify MD/NP if hemoglobin drops by 20 g/L or more *OR* if hemoglobin less than 70 g/L
Urgent, Reason: Post operative, Special Instructions: Supine A/P Lateral, Transport: Portable, Portable Reason: Other (please specify), Other Portable Reason: Post Operative in PACU
Urgent, Reason: Post Operative, Special Instructions: Supine A/P Lateral, Transport: Portable, Portable Reason: Other (please specify), Other Portable Reason: Post operative in PACU

Urgent, Reason: Post Operative, Special Instructions: Pelvic X-Ray: AP Pelvis to include proximal 1/3 of both femurs, Transport: Portable, Portable Reason: Other (please specify), Other Portable Reason: Post operative in PACU

T+1;N, Routine, Reason: Post operative day 1
Inpatient Nurse to initiate the Surgeon Post Operative (Floor) phase of this plan
When discharge outcomes on Clinical Pathway are met
Patient to make follow up appointment with Surgeon in 6 weeks
Patient to make follow up appointment with Surgeon in 2 weeks
Ensure discharge information and prescription given to patient
For patients going home on VTE Prophylaxis

Patient/family to be taught how to inject using LMWH (enoxaparin or dalteparin). Patient to be given a sharps container and the (enoxaparin or dalteparin) teaching sheet (if applicable) and LMWH Patient Kit
Patient/family to be given rivaroxaban teaching sheet (if applicable)
Patient/family to be given ASA teaching sheet (if applicable)
Fax completed Special Authority Form for dalteparin / enoxaparin as required to 1-800-609-4884
For patients NOT going home on VTE Prophylaxis
Patient going home. No post-operative related anticoagulation required
Once baseline on admission, then q2h for 12 hour, then q4h for 36 hour, then q12h for 48 hour and PRN
On arrival to unit, then q4h for 48 hour, then q8h for 48 hour, then q12h until discharge
Review the most current diet order for therapeutic requirements, food texture and fluid thickness. Add anything to be carried forward to the new Diet Order
Start: Clear Fluid Diet, Adjust/Advance Diet to: General Diet, Provider must order starting diet. RN or RD to place subsequent diet order
order rate: 50 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 75 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 50 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 75 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
Convert IV to saline lock when oral intake adequate (1200 to 1500 mL/24 hours unless fluid restricted)
Discontinue IV when IV antibiotics or PCA stopped
If applicable, CAP CVC line PRN. Consult Physician /  NP for order to discontinue CVC if no longer required
Complete the ORTHO Post Operative Pain and Symptom Management and/or ORTHO/GYN/TRAUMA/IR Patient Controlled Analgesia (PCA) (Module) PowerPlan (if POPS not involved)
Insulin Subcutaneous for Patients Eating or NPO (Sliding Scale) (Module)
CBC is recommended if patient has significant cardiac disease history
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, qdaily for 3 day
If Prostalac Stage 1 procedure or other concerns, consider electrolytes, creatinine and urea post-op days 1, 2 and 3
Basic Metabolic Panel (Lytes, Urea, Creat, Gluc)
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, qdaily for 3 day
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, qdaily
Check intra-operative cultures on POD 3, 4 and 5; If positive results, call physician

Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 94% or greater
Consider consultation with Anesthesia, Internal Medicine, Psychiatry, Nurse Practitioner, Geriatric Medicine and Hospitalist
